subject: is pair programming pratical?
msgSnippet: Hi guys, I m new to XP. One thing I feels uncomfortable about XP is pair programming. As Beck wrote: Pair programming is a dialog between two people trying to
messageBody:
Hi guys,
I'm new to XP. One thing I feels uncomfortable about XP is pair
programming. As Beck wrote: "Pair programming is a dialog between two people trying
to simultaneously program and understand how to program better". But
how to make sure this pair's relationship cooperative instead of
competitive(in negative sense)?
For example, we can not always push two people sitting together
and wish they can get along and do the work more effectively than one.
Additionally, I always see the senior people with stronger option than
junior guy. Do you think it is possible to let them communicating equally?

Thank you
Jason

--
Best regards,
junit_jason mailto:junit_jason@...
